issues.description: The solution implementation declares numberOfInscribedStudents as type long, but the problem statement UML (and the exercise text) indicate this attribute should be an int. As implemented, the solution's getTotalNumberOfStudents() method has signature returning int but computes numberOfGuestStudents (int) + numberOfInscribedStudents (long) which yields a long expression — this will not compile and is inconsistent with the UML. The constructor and getter/setter in the solution also use the long type, creating a cross-artifact type mismatch that will confuse students and break the intended implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the attribute types consistent with the problem UML. Preferable fix: change numberOfInscribedStudents from long to int in the solution (update the field declaration, constructor parameter type, getter/setter types, and any use sites). This keeps the getTotalNumberOfStudents() method returning int as specified in the UML and avoids the long->int compilation error. Alternatively, if large values are intended, update the UML and all method signatures to use long (and change getTotalNumberOfStudents() to return long) — but pick one consistent approach across problem, template, and solution.
